item.title: Three Poems
item.description: Calvin-in-exile Blue eyes, pupils dilating to the fire creeping up the cigarette butt, sickly yellow hair, swaying in the harsh blonde Beijing wind, Lines on the face, canyons hewn by rapids over the century’s bends, Calvin Palmer, while still alive, wandered the xueyuan’s corridors like a Dybbuk trying to follow rules defining space and smoke, honored by the natives only in the breach. While still alive, he often remembered the chilly morning he interviewed
